Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class PowerDecorator

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.PowerDecorator
All Implemented Interfaces:
Power
Direct Known Subclasses:
BlockMoveUp, BuildBeforeMove, BuildDomeEverywhere, BuildUnderfoot, CanMoveUp, Down2Win, EndRemoveNeighbour, ExtraBuild, ExtraMove, MovePush, MoveSwap, NoWinPerimeter
public abstract class PowerDecorator
extends java.lang.Object
implements Power
PowerDecorator is an abstract class necessary as a basis for the decoration of gods' powers (it is a part of Decorator pattern). All methods call the corresponding decoratedPower method.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    protected Power decoratedPower
    decoratedPower represents the decorated power.

  • Method Details

    • checkMove

      public java.util.ArrayList<Error> checkMove​(Worker w, int x, int y)
      Description copied from interface: Power
      This method checks if moving the worker to a given square is a legit move
      Specified by:
      checkMove in interface Power
      Parameters:
      w - is the worker that wants to move
      x - is the x square coordinate where the worker wants to move
      y - is the y square coordinate where the worker wants to move
      Returns:
      an ArrayList that is empty if the move is legal, otherwise it contains the errors that prevent the worker from moving.

    • checkBuild

      public java.util.ArrayList<Error> checkBuild​(Worker w, int x, int y, int l)
      Description copied from interface: Power
      This method checks if a worker can build in a given square.
      Specified by:
      checkBuild in interface Power
      Parameters:
      w - is the worker that wants to build
      x - is the x square coordinate where the worker wants to build
      y - is the y square coordinate where the worker wants to build
      l - is the level the worker wants to build
      Returns:
      an ArrayList that is empty if the build is legal, otherwise it contains the errors that prevent the worker from building.

    • endOfTurn

      public boolean endOfTurn​(java.util.ArrayList<Worker> workers)
      Description copied from interface: Power
      This method is called when a player finish his turn. It checks that player has done standard moves and reset all counters or flag for the turn in model.
      Specified by:
      endOfTurn in interface Power
      Parameters:
      workers - is the arrayList of worker that player uses
      Returns:
      true : The turn is correctly finish false : The turn cannot finish now
